recommendations.title: Top 10 Myths About Bedbugs
recommendations.excerpt: The insects, making a comeback around the globe, cannot fly and are really not interested in hanging out on your body—but they do occasionally bite during the day.

recommendations.title: Stephen Hawking Left Us Bold Predictions on AI, Superhumans, and Aliens
recommendations.excerpt: The great physicist’s thoughts on the future of the human race and the fragility of planet Earth.

recommendations.title: The 200-year-old diary that's rewriting gay history
recommendations.excerpt: A diary written by a Yorkshire farmer more than 200 years ago is being hailed as providing remarkable evidence of tolerance towards same-sex attraction in Britain much earlier than previously imagined.

recommendations.title: Why Most of America Is Terrible at Making Biscuits
recommendations.excerpt: There’s a scientific reason no one outside the South can nail them.

recommendations.title: How This One Font Took Over the World
recommendations.excerpt: It’s the font we deserve, but is it the one we need right now?

recommendations.title: When You Get a Stitch in Your Side, What’s Really Going On?
recommendations.excerpt: Doctors still don’t know what causes it, or how to stop it.

recommendations.title: I stumbled across a huge Airbnb scam that’s taking over London
recommendations.excerpt: The curious tale of a man called Christian, the Catholic church, David Schwimmer’s wife, a secret hotel and an Airbnb scam running riot on the streets of London

recommendations.title: A Very Old Man for a Wolf
recommendations.excerpt: He was the alpha male of the first pack to live in Oregon since 1947. For years, a state biologist tracked him, collared him, counted his pups, weighed him, photographed him, and protected him. But then the animal known as OR4 broke one too many rules.

recommendations.title: When living apart keeps you together
recommendations.excerpt: For some couples, sharing their hearts doesn’t mean sharing a home.

recommendations.title: How to Write Email with Military Precision
recommendations.excerpt: A few tips on how to quickly and clearly relay information and avoid miscommunication.

recommendations.title: The most fascinating riot you’ve never heard of
recommendations.excerpt: The Astor Place Opera House Riot of 1849 combined two of 19th-century America’s favorite pastimes: going to the theater and rioting.

recommendations.title: How soccer became broken beyond repair
recommendations.excerpt: The game is going through an unprecedented period of financial and competitive imbalance. Journalist Miguel Delaney investigates how we got here and – crucially – whether the dominance of the mega-rich is here to stay

recommendations.title: How to Stop Catastrophizing: An Expert’s Guide
recommendations.excerpt: A clinical psychologist suggests a three-pronged plan for tackling anxiety and approaching each day logically and positively.

recommendations.title: How Bon Appétit Accidentally Made YouTube’s Most Beloved Stars
recommendations.excerpt: Claire, Brad, and the gang have created not only a successful series but a devoted fandom.

recommendations.title: 9 Books That Should Be Adapted as Video Games
recommendations.excerpt: What book should be the next Witcher?

recommendations.title: You’re a Bad Listener: Here’s How to Remember What People Say
recommendations.excerpt: We come into conversations with our own agendas and low attention spans, but if you want to build better relationships you need to master active listening.

recommendations.title: ‘I Am the Smelly Co-worker’
recommendations.excerpt: “I’m at a loss about how to feel comfortable in my workplace again.”

recommendations.title: Why Athletes Need a ‘Quiet Eye’
recommendations.excerpt: Want to know who will win a World Cup game or Wimbledon match? Look closely at the athletes’ eyes — including when it seems they’re about to lose.

recommendations.title: The Single Reason Why People Can't Write, According to a Harvard Psychologist
recommendations.excerpt: This common affliction is behind so much unclear and confusing writing in the world today.

recommendations.title: The Curious Case of the Bog Bodies
recommendations.excerpt: Why do so many of the ancient corpses found in Europe’s peat bogs show signs of violent death?

recommendations.title: Was Jeanne Calment the Oldest Person Who Ever Lived—or a Fraud?
recommendations.excerpt: Some researchers have cast doubt on the record of the celebrated supercentenarian.

recommendations.title: Key Change: How a Shifting Climate Is Transforming Florida
recommendations.excerpt: Rahawa Haile grew up surrounded by the beauty and kitsch of South Florida. Now she returns and wonders what happens when the places we love start to disappear.

recommendations.title: Living Full-Time in a Toyota Tacoma
recommendations.excerpt: How a writer turned a midsize pickup into the ultimate adventure home.

recommendations.title: When You Burn Fat, Where Does it Actually Go?
recommendations.excerpt: Getting rid of fat can be exhausting, but it’s as natural as breathing.

recommendations.title: This man says he's stockpiling billions of our photos
recommendations.excerpt: Clearview AI is controversial for many reasons, but perhaps the most important is its massive database. The company claims to have scraped more than 3 billion photos from the internet, including from popular social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube.

recommendations.title: Why People Get the ‘Sunday Scaries’
recommendations.excerpt: The end of a weekend has always been unpleasant, but there is something distinctly modern about the anxiety many people feel on the eve of a workweek.

recommendations.title: Emotional Intelligence: The Social Skills You Weren’t Taught in School
recommendations.excerpt: How well do you recognize and understand your emotions? What about the emotions of those around you?

recommendations.title: I Trained Myself to Be Less Busy — and it Dramatically Improved My Life
recommendations.excerpt: My overwhelming schedule left me exhausted and empty. Here’s how I fought back.

recommendations.title: How To Break Toxic Relationship Patterns
recommendations.excerpt: Give yourself a chance for change.

recommendations.title: ‘The intelligence coup of the century’
recommendations.excerpt: For decades, the CIA read the encrypted communications of allies and adversaries.
